alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 04 at 5:32AM MDT until April 05 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG IN EFFECT TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING FOR ALL AREAS BELOW SNOWPACK EXCEPT THE NORTH-CENTRAL MOUNTAINS FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Strong west to northwest winds are expected to develop Tuesday over northern and central New Mexico. These winds will be combined with minimum relative humidity between 10 and 15 percent, as well as temperatures ranging from 5 to nearly 20 degrees above normal and an unstable airmass. While critical conditions should diminish later Tuesday evening, they are expected to return Wednesday over western and central New Mexico where several hours of single digit relative humidity are forecast along with strong to very strong northwest winds. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT TUESDAY... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from noon to 8 PM MDT Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AREA AND TIMING...All areas below snowpack except the North Central Mountains from noon Tuesday through Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West to northwest 25 to 40 mph with gusts to 55 or 60 mph. The strongest gusts are expected in the Central Highlands and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from around 10 to 15 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: East Central Plains; Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northeast Highlands; Northeast Plains; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
